How We Work

Vanguard has implemented a hybrid working model for the majority of our crew members, designed to capture the benefits of enhanced flexibility while enabling in-person learning, collaboration, and connection. We believe our mission-driven and highly collaborative culture is a critical enabler to support long-term client outcomes and enrich the employee experience.

title: Orion Migration Sr. Analyst
job_description:
Comcast Business offers a suite of Connectivity, Communications, Networking, Cybersecurity, Wireless, and Managed Solutions to help global organizations of all sizes prepare for what’s next. Powered by the nation’s largest Gig-speed broadband network and backed by 24/7 customer support, Comcast Business is the nation’s largest technology provider to small businesses and one of the leading service providers to the Enterprise market. Comcast Business has been consistently recognized by industry analysts and associations as a leader and innovator, and one of the fastest growing providers of Ethernet services. 

Job Summary

Lead and manage diverse programs focused on business reengineering to enhance operational efficiency and customer experience. Collaborate with a cross-functional team representing all divisions to identify and address current challenges. Analyze and define existing processes across Marketing, Provisioning, Customer Care, and Technical Operations, and design future state processes enabled by advanced technology. Leverage extensive experience, knowledge, and skills within your discipline to prioritize tasks independently. Serve as a mentor and resource for less experienced colleagues. 

Job Description

Core Responsibilities

  • Leads analysis and design of existing and new business processes that span multiple areas of the organization, including Customer Operations, Sales Operations, Marketing, Training, Finance and Legal.
  • Develops scalable processes to support and benefit the Company's architecture vision.
  • Deconstructs technical concepts and metrics to facilitate process development.
  • Helps to define success metrics for each new system or process and establishes a plan to track, monitor and measure the success of those metrics.
  • Completes assessments of business processes and documents each of the following areas: problem statements, process flows, gap analyses and solution recommendations.
  • Develops repeatable and thus scalable, plans and processes in order to speed time to market and improve operational efficiency.
  • Interacts closely with matrixed cross-functional teams (both field and corporate) in order to secure alignment.
  • Diagnoses, corrects and documents issues, risks and problems using Quality Assurance (QA) practices.
  • Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
  • Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
  • Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Employees at all levels are expected to:

  • Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
  • Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
  • Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
  • Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
  • Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
  • Drive results and growth.
  • Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
  • Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

Disclaimer:

  • This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.

Additional Job Description:

We are seeking a Migration & Data Transition Senior Analyst to oversee business data migrations and system transitions. This role requires strong project management skills and expertise in data mapping, billing cycles, system integrations, and stakeholder coordination.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead migration meetings and resolve issues.
  • Track migration items and align billing cycles.
  • Maintain migration playbooks and population files.
  • Oversee rate code sheets and equipment mapping.
  • Monitor open balances and manage service identification.
  • Develop mapping files and provide migration reports.
  • Communicate migration schedules to customers.
  • Perform validation checks for data accuracy.

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, IT, or related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in data migration and system transitions.
  • Strong knowledge of billing cycles and system integrations.
  • Proficiency in Excel, SQL, and data analysis tools.
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with enterprise telecommunications and billing systems.
  • Familiarity with MDM processes and Agile methodologies.

Comcast is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

Skills:

Customer Experience (CX); Sales Operations; Business Processes; Prioritization; Metrics Development; Results-Oriented; Cross-Functional Teamwork

Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Comcast provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a Commission under the terms of an applicable plan, while most non-sales positions are eligible for a Bonus. Additionally, Comcast provides best-in-class Benefits to eligible employees. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most. That’s why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality – to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life. Please visit the compensation and benefits summary on our careers site for more details.

Education

Bachelor's Degree

While possessing the stated degree is preferred, Comcast also may consider applicants who hold some combination of coursework and experience, or who have extensive related professional experience.

Relevant Work Experience

5-7 Years

title: HRIS Analyst
job_description:
Description

At BrightView, the best teams are created and maintained here. If you are searching for your next fulfilling career, picture yourself on a best-in-class team where you can grow to be your brightest. We’re looking for an HRIS Analyst. Can you picture yourself here?

Here’s what you’d do:

The Analyst, HRIS is responsible for maintaining and optimizing our Human Resources Information System (HRIS) and related People systems to support HR operations and strategic initiatives. They serve as a key liaison between HR, IT, and system vendors, maintaining system structure, ensuring data integrity, streamlining processes, generating reports, and recommending system enhancements to improve efficiency and user experience. The HRIS Analyst also plays a key role in system upgrades, configuration, and troubleshooting, ensuring the HRIS meets organizational needs and compliance requirements.

You’d be responsible for:

  • Manage day-to-day operations of the Workday HRIS platform, including configurations, business process workflows, and user access
  • Maintain and optimize Workday modules, including Core HCM, Recruiting, Talent Management, Payroll, Compensation, Benefits, and Time Tracking
  • Ensure the accuracy and integrity of HR data within the HRIS systems and support compliance with internal policies and external regulations related to HR data
  • Generate custom reports, dashboards, and metrics for HR leadership and other departments
  • Assist with data migration and data integration between Workday and other systems
  • Assist in the configuration of new Workday releases, upgrades, and patches
  • Identify and troubleshoot system issues and work with IT and Workday support teams for resolutions
  • Continuously evaluate system functionality and recommend process improvements and system optimizations
  • Provide end-user support and training to HR staff and other Workday users within the organization
  • Assist in developing training materials, documentation, and user guides to ensure smooth system adoption and usage
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including HR, IT, and external vendors, to implement system improvements or new functionalities.
  • Participate in HRIS-related projects, including system upgrades and implementation of new modules, including testing new features, configurations, and changes to ensure proper functionality
  • Assist with other People Data and HR System support projects as needed

The HRIS team supports all features and functionality within the Workday system and any HR-related data within the E1 system and are cross-trained in the basics across all modules. In addition, analysts are assigned areas of focus to allow for dedicated support, deeper analytics, and more comprehensive subject expertise.

These systems focus areas, and their primary functionality, include, but are not limited to:

  • Core HCM and Security 
    • Core HR: manages employee records, organizational structure, and workforce planning
    • Security: user role definition, configuration, assignment, and audit
  • Talent Optimization 
    • Recruiting: talent acquisition, candidate management, and hiring processes
    • Talent Management: includes performance management, employee development, goal setting, and succession planning
    • Learning: supports employee learning and development programs, including training and certifications
  • Total Rewards 
    • Compensation: salary, merit cycles, bonuses, and stock options
    • Benefits: eligibility, enrollments, and integrations (payroll/carrier)
    • Absence Management: tracks and manages employee leave and absences, including vacation, sick leave, and other types of time off

You might be a good fit if you have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Information Systems, Business Administration, or a related field.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in HRIS, Workday administration, or a similar role
  • Strong knowledge of Workday HRIS modules, including Core HCM, Recruiting, Performance Management, Benefits, and/or Compensation
  • Experience in system configuration, data analysis, and reporting
  • Advanced in Excel and other data analysis tools
  • Understanding of HR business processes and how they align with HRIS functionality
  • Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to analyze complex HRIS issues
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
  • Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
  • Preferred: Workday Certification (HCM, Benefits, talent Optimization, or other relevant certifications)
  • Position requires application-specific experience related to their assigned business areas, ensuring familiarity with relevant systems and tools to effectively analyze and support business processes.
  • A proven track record of proactive support and maintenance of enterprise-level applications, including coordination of complex issues amongst internal business teams, IT, and vendors.
  • Analytical thinker, able to troubleshoot technical problems and escalate as needed to the proper business or technical resource.
  • Adept at identifying and implementing new processes / technologies to increase revenues, improve efficiencies / reduce costs, or reduce risk.
  • Experience working with SQL databases and writing SQL queries to analyze data preferred.
  • Proficient in MS Office suite, Microsoft Project, Microsoft Visio.
  • Prefer experience with SQL Server Query Analyzer and SQL Server Enterprise Manager
  • Experience working in an environment with ITSM concepts, including change management.

Here’s what to know about working here:

Here at BrightView, we’re as passionate about caring for our clients as we are about caring for each other. Though we’re the nation’s leading landscape company, we maintain a small company feel and supportive environment that makes our team members feel at home.

If you’re looking to join a team of talented go-getters who tackle big vision projects other companies could only dream of, you just might have found your match. With our range of services, including landscape design, development, maintenance and enhancements, there’s no limit to what we can do, and what you can achieve.

Growing Everyday

Like the communities we serve, you are on a constant path of discovery to shape your career and personal development. In addition to best-in-class opportunities and competitive salary, you may be eligible for benefits and perks like:

  • Paid time off
  • Health and wellness coverage
  • 401k savings plan

Start Your Bright New Career Journey

BrightView is an Equal Employment Opportunity and E-Verify Employer.

title: Senior Business Analyst, Workday
job_description:
At BrightView, the best teams are created and maintained here. If you are searching for your next fulfilling career, picture yourself on a best-in-class team where you can grow to be your brightest. We’re looking for a Senior Business Analyst with experience in Workday HCM to join our IT team. Can you picture yourself here?

Hybrid Schedule: 4 Days Onsite in Blue Bell, PA

Here’s what you’d do:

Join our Workday implementation team as an analyst to help establish the future of HR systems at BrightView while supporting some of our existing HR and Payroll solutions. The individual will act as a bridge between BrightView business units, IT, and third-party vendors. Under general guidance from management and senior team members, responsibilities include gathering requirements, managing projects and work streams of various sizes, supporting deployed solutions, and conceptualizing potential future solutions. 

You’d be responsible for:

  • Utilizing deep knowledge of Workday HCM to drive technology solutions.
  • Working together with project managers, subject matter experts, fellow Business Analysts, consultants and developers to establish cohesive project strategies.
  • Supporting day-to-day production activities in a complex technical environment consisting of Workday, JD Edwards Enterprise One, and other applications and associated integrations.
  • Communicating technical concepts clearly with non-technical personnel across the organization.
  • Gathering, analyzing, and documenting business requirements.
  • Serving as the liaison between business users and technical resources.
  • Facilitating IT and User Acceptance Testing of completed solutions.
  • Organizing assignments and priorities to ensure that project deadlines and internal customer expectations are met.
  • Providing regular status updates to management, including issue escalations when necessary.
  • Coaching and mentoring other team members to help build their skills.
  • Working individually, or in collaboration with others, depending on project needs.
  • Adhering to IT General Controls including Change Management.

You might be a good fit if you have:

  • 5+ years’ experience in a Business Analyst or equivalent role, preferably with a services organization.
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science or another technical field, or equivalent experience.
  • 5+ years’ experience using Workday to support key HR capabilities.
  • Detailed knowledge of Workday’s solutions for one or more of the following: Employee and Manager Self Service, Absence Tracking, Talent & Performance Management, Benefits Enrollment, Compensation, Applicant Tracking, and Employee Onboarding.
  • Prefer experience in integrating Workday with third-party payroll solutions, preferably JD Edwards Enterprise One.
  • The ability to understand HR and Payroll business needs and advise on best practices.
  • Awareness of payroll systems and practices for both union and non-union employees.
  • Success supporting multiple custom and third-party application interfaces
  • Self-motivation, attention to detail, and ability to balance competing priorities.
  • Proficiency in writing professional business requirements, test plans, design requirements, user documentation and technical specifications.
  • Experience with Waterfall and Agile project management methodologies.
  • Experience in supporting and maintaining enterprise-level applications, including analyzing complex issues and coordinating issue-resolution activities involving multiple resources and stakeholders.
  • Adept at identifying and implementing new processes and technologies to increase efficiency, control costs, reduce risk, etc.
  • Experience working with SQL databases and writing SQL queries to analyze data preferred.

Here’s what to know about working here:

Here at BrightView, we’re as passionate about caring for our clients as we are about caring for each other. Though we’re the nation’s leading landscape company, we maintain a small company feel and supportive environment that makes our team members feel at home.

If you’re looking to join a team of talented go-getters who tackle big vision projects other companies could only dream of, you just might have found your match. With our range of services, including landscape design, development, maintenance and enhancements, there’s no limit to what we can do, and what you can achieve.

Growing Everyday

Like the communities we serve, you are on a constant path of discovery to shape your career and personal development. In addition to best-in-class opportunities and competitive salary, you may be eligible for benefits and perks like:

  • Paid time off
  • Health and wellness coverage
  • 401k savings plan

Start Your Bright New Career Journey

BrightView is an Equal Employment Opportunity and E-Verify Employer.
